ygData.subject: RE: Re: Twinking (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I think this is where some people are having the problem.  If you stopped right here with your post some would agree.  But you add more with this
ygData.messageBody:
> Yup, this stuff I don't have much problem with, though as I've
> said it should be limited to items appropriate for the level
>
I think this is where some people are having the problem. If you stopped
right here with your post some would agree. But you add more with this
statement.

> if you don't want to lessen the gaming experience.
>
As I have stated earlier some people have a different definition of what
their gaming experience is. You may enjoy something that I don't, and
someone else may enjoy doing it a different way. The only time it comes a
problem is when someone's gaming enjoyment interferes with anothers. I used
my friend at work as an example: his gaming experience enjoyment consists
of being able to use cheat codes. If he can't cheat at a game, he won't
play. My gaming enjoyment is exploration and dying :). Another friend from
work has the enjoyment of safety and no death. As a level 20 druid he has
died twice. And another friend from work enjoys tradeskills. He is a
master jewelcrafter and is working on blacksmithing now (which I think
trade skills are boring). No one knows what someone's gaming experience is
- it is different from everyone.
